page.title: 06Emborough Church
page.content: The 700 year old church is now redundant but a service was held there on Palm Sunday in 1985. The Churchyard is still used for burials. In the floor of the sanctuary there is a stone memorial to two small children who died in 1700 bearing the words: "Thee pretty babes for long did play before the Lord called them away." There is also in the same floor a memorial to three small children of one family who died a few years later. The Font is Norman and there is a gallery at the West end supported on oak pillars. Extensive views fo the surrounding countryside can be enjoyed from the North doorway of the Church.
